textboxes.description: One day, Bubba finds a neatly folded, handwritten letter slipped under his camper’s door. It’s beautifully calligraphed, with a royal seal. The letter claims to be from a Nigerian prince who needs help transferring his fortune, offering Bubba a substantial cut for his assistance.

choices.text: Ignore it and toss it out

textboxes.description: Intrigued, Bubba reads that all the prince needs is a small sum upfront for “transaction fees” — around 10,000 — in return for millions. The letter is filled with elegant prose, making the deal sound almost magical. Bubba can’t help but feel flattered.

choices.text: Send the money and await fortune

textboxes.description: Bubba, dreaming of wealth, sends the 10,000 to the prince’s address. Days pass with no word. Finally, another letter arrives asking for more, explaining it’s 'just one last payment.'

choices.text: Send more money, hoping it’s the last
Realize it’s a scam and stop all contact

textboxes.description: Em reads the letter with a smirk, pointing out several red flags. 'Handwritten letters? A fortune transfer? Bubba, this has scam written all over it.' Bubba feels a bit embarrassed but grateful for her insight.

choices.text: Thank Em and drop the idea
Ignore Em’s advice and continue communicating with the prince

textboxes.description: With a hunch, Bubba researches the so-called prince’s lineage. As he digs deeper, he realizes there’s no record of such a person. The scam becomes obvious.

choices.text: Confront the sender with his findings
Stop all communication and warn others

textboxes.description: Bubba, enlightened by Em’s advice, avoids the scam and learns to be more cautious in the future. He even shares his experience to prevent others from being deceived.
Bubba realizes the scam but is disappointed, losing some faith in people’s intentions. It’s a bitter lesson, but at least he didn’t lose everything.
Despite warnings, Bubba keeps sending money, and soon he’s in serious debt. The prince vanishes without a trace, leaving Bubba heartbroken and financially drained.
